body:
Yeah, thanks, but that way I know, it is in the docs. 

The real question is: How to achieve that **using binded params**. If I can use binded params in other queries, why i cant use in 'like' queries?

This is the question.
Thanks.

> but that way I know, it is in the docs.

I am very sure it is not, if you find it, it needs to be fixed.

When using array syntax, the binding is done internally by yii. binding is only needed if you write string condition.

By

> but that way I know, it is in the docs.

I meant:

> ->andWhere(['like', 'address.district', $location])

My only preoccupation about that is: will Yii do some type of sql injection prevention (even that binding data in PDO layer) when I call `->andWhere(['like', 'address.district', $location])` without expressely binding parameters the same way it will do if I call something like `->where('fieldX' => ':data', [':data' => $someData])` expressely binding params?

Thanks @cebe

> will Yii do some type of sql injection prevention

of course

@lichunqiang, maybe it can be _of course_ for you, not for all just because of one detail: in the most of methods we have a :placeholder but specifically in this one we haven't. 

So I really don't want to think what is your definition of _of course_ because it could be something not so natural or logical like in this case.
We can mention it in the guide

Hi @SilverFire, 

I am still not sure about the exact way that Yii uses `->where(['like', 'field', $value]).` calls. Does Yii use a pdo prepared statement internally even without we use a `:placeholder`?

OR

... Yii just insert the own `$value` inside the sql query like it does in other calls like `->where(['field', $value])`? In this case, how we could use `like` with prepared statements instead?

I would like to investigate it but I have no free time for a while. 
Thank u.

Thank you, @unclead 

Based in your answer, I have debugged `yii\db\QueryBuilder::buildLikeCondition()` and it generates a final string like `" 'address'.'district' LIKE :qp0 "` where `:qp0` will be the `$value` after have been binded.
